1.speaker: PANDA
1.japanese: さっきから　ず～っとそれやってるけど
1.english: You've been doing that for a while,

2.speaker: PANDA
2.english: but what exactly are you doing?

3.speaker: FT PANDA
3.english: It's a side job. We just had our third child,

4.speaker: FT PANDA
4.japanese: 今度真ん中の子が小学校だから
4.english: and our middle one is starting elementary school,

5.speaker: FT PANDA
5.english: so she needs quite a few things. I see.

6.speaker: FT PANDA
6.japanese: 暇だったらパンダくんも手伝ってくれない
6.english: If you're bored, would you help me out, Panda?

7.speaker: PANDA
7.japanese: ほんとに暇つぶしのためだけにならいいよ
7.english: If it's solely for the purpose of relieving my boredom, sure.

8.speaker: FT PANDA
8.japanese: キミの辞書には社交辞令という言葉ないんだね
8.english: Apparently, "social etiquette"doesn't exist in your dictionary.

9.speaker: FT PANDA
9.japanese: じゃあ　こっちのティッシュに
9.english: Then will you put these ads into these tissue packs?

11.speaker: PANDA
11.japanese: 地味に見えてほんとに地味な仕事だね
11.english: This job doesn't just look dull. It actually is dull, isn't it?

12.speaker: GUY1
12.japanese: あのパンダ内職してるぞ
12.english: Those pandas are doing a side job!

13.speaker: GUY2
13.english: I guess the zoo's fallen on hard times, too.

16.speaker: HANDA
16.japanese: 内職するパンダを見せる動物園がどこにあるんですか
16.english: What zoo would allow their pandas to be seen doing side jobs?

17.speaker: HANDA
17.japanese: 動物園大変なんだなって　お客さんに言われましたよ
17.english: I overheard a customer say that the zoo must be going through some hard times.

18.speaker: PANDA
18.japanese: まあまあ　珍しがって　お客さんが押し寄せるよ
18.english: Come on. Visitors will flock in to see us doing something so unusual.

19.speaker: HANDA
19.japanese: そういう　押し寄せ方はダメだよ
19.english: We can't have them flock in for that.

20.speaker: FT PANDA
20.japanese: 見えないところでならいいよね
20.english: So it'd be okay if they couldn't see us, right? Huh?

21.speaker: FT PANDA
21.japanese: 内職　見えないところでなら　いいよね
21.english: We can do the side job if we aren't seen, right?

24.speaker: KIRINO
24.japanese: なんで内職　オッケーしちゃうんですか
24.english: Why'd you okay their side job?

25.speaker: HANDA
25.japanese: えっ　見えないところなら　いいでしょ
25.english: Well, it's okay if nobody sees them, isn't it? It's not okay for pandas to sneak around doing side jobs.

26.speaker: KIRINO
26.japanese: パンダに言いくるめられるの　やめてください
26.english: Please don't let the pandas trick you.

27.speaker: HANDA
27.japanese: 常勤さんのところ大変なんだって
27.english: Well, Mr. Full-time has a lot going on right now.

28.speaker: KIRINO
28.japanese: いやいや　そこはちゃんとしましょうよ
28.english: Oh, come on. We need to be proper about this.

29.speaker: KIRINO
29.japanese: あっ　そうだ　園長からなんですけど
29.english: Oh, that's right. I have a message from the zoo director.

30.speaker: KIRINO
30.japanese: 来週から派遣パンダさんが来るそうです
30.english: Starting next week, we'll have a temp panda.

32.speaker: PANDA
32.english: Thanks for all your hard work!

33.speaker: FT PANDA
33.japanese: どうしよう　パンダくん
33.english: What am I going to do, Panda?

34.speaker: PANDA
34.japanese: 何　常勤パンダさん
34.english: What is it, Mr. Full-time Panda? The arrival of a temp panda isn't good. Why's that? There's no need for three pandas at this zoo.

35.speaker: FT PANDA
35.japanese: 僕たちリストラされるかもしれないよ
35.english: We might be laid off. Laid off?

36.speaker: PENGUIN
36.japanese: ねぇ　笹子さん　休みの日って何してるの
36.english: Hey, Miss Sasako. What do you do on your days off?

37.speaker: SASAKO
37.japanese: 休みの日ですか　休んでます
37.english: On my days off? I take the day off.

38.speaker: PENGUIN
38.japanese: うん　だから何して
38.english: Yeah, but what do you do?

39.speaker: SASAKO
39.english: I take all day off. That's not what I mean...

40.speaker: PENGUIN
40.japanese: もういいや　シロクマくん　さっきから何してんの
40.english: Never mind. What are you doing, Polar Bear?

41.speaker: POLAR BEAR
41.japanese: タコさんウィンナーを作ってるんだ
41.english: I'm making an octopus-shaped hot dog.

42.speaker: PENGUIN
42.english: An octopus-shaped hot dog? I see.

44.speaker: POLAR BEAR
44.japanese: うん　タコさんウィンナー
44.english: An octopus-shaped hot dog. It's sort of scary. How'd you even make this out of hot dogs? It accents any lunch box. I don't think it would even fit in a lunch box...

45.speaker: PENGUIN
45.japanese: どうしたの　嬉しそうな顔して
45.english: What's going on with you? You seem happy.

46.speaker: PANDA
46.japanese: 僕　リストラされるかもしれないんだ

47.speaker: PENGUIN
47.japanese: キミ　意味わかってる
47.english: Do you understand what that means?

48.speaker: PANDA
48.japanese: もちろん　派遣パンダさんが来たら
48.english: Of course! When Mr. Temp Panda comes, I might be laid off!

49.speaker: PENGUIN
49.japanese: リストラ　イヤじゃないの
49.english: Wouldn't getting laid off be bad?

51.speaker: PANDA
51.japanese: これで堂々と家でゴロゴロできるよ
51.english: Then I can boldly laze around at home.

52.speaker: PENGUIN
52.japanese: キミ　斬新な発想するね
52.english: That's a rather new way to approach that.

53.speaker: PENGUIN
53.japanese: パンダくんになれたら楽しいだろうね
53.english: It must be a lot of fun being you.

54.speaker: PANDA
54.japanese: 早く来ないかな～　派遣パンダさん
54.english: I hope Mr. Temp Panda gets here soon.

56.speaker: HANDA
56.japanese: 今日から　派遣されてきた
56.english: Mr. Temp Panda, who'll be starting here today.

58.speaker: TEMP
58.japanese: よろしくお願いします
58.english: Pleased to meet you. Nice to meet you.

59.speaker: HANDA
59.japanese: わからないことはこの２人に聞いてください
59.english: If you have any questions, feel free to ask these two.

61.speaker: HANDA
61.japanese: それと　今日は午前中に保育園の子たちが来ますから
61.english: Also, we'll be getting some preschoolers this morning,

62.speaker: HANDA
62.japanese: サービスしてあげてください
62.english: so make sure you give them plenty of service. Mr. Panda! Mr. Panda! Mr. Panda!

63.speaker: FT PANDA
63.japanese: パンダくんと派遣パンダさん

64.speaker: FT PANDA
64.japanese: 僕ちょっと　そこの陰で　内職やっちゃうから
64.english: I'm going to hide over there and work on this,

65.speaker: FT PANDA
65.japanese: 午前中はキミたちでお願いします
65.english: so I'll leave the morning to you.

66.speaker: TEMP
66.japanese: 何を言ってるんですかあなたは
66.english: What on earth are you talking about? How could you be doing a side job?

67.speaker: FT PANDA
67.japanese: いや～　ティッシュにチラシを入れるんです
67.english: I'm just putting ads into tissue packs.

68.speaker: TEMP
68.japanese: そうじゃなくてそれはパンダのやることですか
68.english: That's not what I meant! Is that something pandas should be doing?

69.speaker: FT PANDA
69.japanese: パンダくんキミからなんか言ってあげて

70.speaker: PANDA
70.japanese: ご飯　食べてからにするよ

71.speaker: TEMP
71.japanese: もっと　まじめにパンダのかわいさを見せましょうよ
71.english: Let's work harder to show the cuteness of pandas!

72.speaker: PANDA
72.japanese: けど　僕が　ゴロゴロしてたらかわいいよ
72.english: But if I just laze around, it's already cute.

73.speaker: TEMP
73.japanese: パンダに甘えてませんか
73.english: Is that really enough for a panda?

74.speaker: TEMP
74.japanese: ちゃんと必死に　ゴロゴロしましょうよ
74.english: Let's work harder on lazing around!

76.speaker: PANDA
76.japanese: 僕はそういうゴロゴロは違うと思うんだよね
76.english: I don't think that's the right kind of lazing around.

78.speaker: PANDA
78.japanese: ゴロゴロはさ　なんていうかガツガツしたゴロゴロじゃなくて
78.english: Lazing around should be more like, not the stern kind of lazing around,

79.speaker: PANDA
79.japanese: ゴロゴロしたゴロゴロであるべきでしょう
79.english: but the lazing around kind of lazing around.

80.speaker: PENGUIN
80.japanese: そんなに熱を入れて主張することでもないけどね
80.english: I don't think this is something to state so passionately.

81.speaker: SASAKO
81.japanese: 派遣パンダさんってまじめな方なんですね
81.english: Mr. Temp Panda sounds very serious.

82.speaker: PANDA
82.japanese: ダラダラしたゴロゴロのほうがかわいいに決まってるよ
82.english: Of course, the relaxed kind of lazing around is cuter.

83.speaker: PENGUIN
83.japanese: けど派遣パンダさんはプロのゴロゴロでしょう
83.english: But he's a pro at lazing, right? So cute!

84.speaker: KIDS
84.english: Mr. Panda! Mr. Panda! So cute!

85.speaker: PANDA
85.japanese: だから　今度総選挙をやるんだよ
85.english: That's why we're going to be holding an election.

87.speaker: PANDA
87.japanese: パンダのセンターを決めるの
87.english: To decide who's going to be the central panda.

88.speaker: PANDA
88.japanese: 誰がいちばんかわいいかお客さんに投票してもらうんだ
88.english: We're going to have the visitors vote on the cutest panda.

91.speaker: SASAKO
91.japanese: そこはいいんじゃないですか
91.english: I think we can leave that aspect alone... How's that look?

92.speaker: KIRINO
92.japanese: いいんじゃないですか

93.speaker: GUY
93.japanese: なに　あれ　選挙
93.english: What's that? An election? What's this?

94.speaker: GIRL
94.japanese: あの子　いいじゃない
94.english: I like that one. How about that panda?

95.speaker: HANDA
95.japanese: お客さんも喜んでるみたいだし盛り上がりそうだね
95.english: The visitors seem to be interested, too. This could get exciting. I'm going to do my best! For my wife and kids! Service, service!

99.speaker: KIRINO
99.japanese: あんなに追い詰められたパンダ　見たことないですね
99.english: I don't think I've ever seen him so backed into a corner. {\a6}Service, service!

100.speaker: HANDA
100.japanese: いいんじゃない　やる気になってるんだから
100.english: I think it's a good thing. He's trying real hard.

103.speaker: HANDA
103.japanese: かわいいね　あそこで落ちるんすね
103.english: How cute. I see what he did there.

104.speaker: KIRINO
104.japanese: プロのパンダっすねぇ

106.speaker: GUY
106.english: So cute! Hasn't changed at all.

107.speaker: KIRINO
107.japanese: 普段着のパンダくんですね

108.speaker: PANDA
108.japanese: 僕は最高にだらしなく　ダラダラしよう
108.english: I'm going to shamelessly laze around.

109.speaker: PANDA
109.japanese: それが僕のかわいさなんだ
109.english: That's what's so cute about me.

112.speaker: HANDA
112.english: First place: Mr. Temp Panda. What?

114.speaker: HANDA
114.english: Second place: Panda. What? Second place? Fourth place: Mr. Full-time Panda.

115.speaker: FT PANDA
115.japanese: なんで４位　…っていうか　なんで３位とばすの
115.english: Why am I fourth? Or rather, why was third place skipped?

116.speaker: HANDA
116.english: Well... I lost to Panda, who was sleeping... Or rather... I lost to Mr. Handa, who was cleaning. Oh. I-I'm sorry...

117.speaker: SASAKO
117.japanese: それで派遣パンダさんは
117.english: And so what happened to Mr. Temp Panda?

118.speaker: PANDA
118.japanese: 次の派遣先に行くんだって
118.english: He's going to his next temp site.

119.speaker: PANDA
119.english: This was only short term. If it was so short term,

120.speaker: FT PANDA
120.japanese: こんな辛いランキング決めなくて　よかったんじゃないかな
120.english: was there any reason to make this harsh ranking?

121.speaker: PANDA
121.japanese: 元気だしてよ　常勤パンダさん
121.english: Cheer up, Mr. Full-time Panda. This'll be on me.

123.speaker: PANDA
123.english: At least it's not tenth place.

124.speaker: FT PANDA
124.japanese: 私はもうパンダとしての　自信なくしたよ
124.english: I've lost my confidence as a panda...

125.speaker: LLAMA
125.japanese: あの…　よかったら僕
125.english: Pardon me, but if you'd like,

126.speaker: LLAMA
126.japanese: パンダコーナーと代わりましょうか
126.english: I'll trade places with you at the Panda Corner. I do pretty well as a panda.

127.speaker: FT PANDA
127.japanese: もうパンダやめようかな…
127.english: Maybe I'll quit being a panda. Could I get a caramel latte, Mr. Polar Bear?

128.speaker: POLAR BEAR
128.english: How about you take that off?

130.speaker: TIGER
130.japanese: よぅ　オオカミ　元気にしてたか

134.speaker: WOLF
134.japanese: ずいぶん太ったね　少し見ないうちに
134.english: Looks like you gained some weight in the short time I haven't seen you.

135.speaker: TIGER
135.japanese: アッハハ　いやぁ　嫁の作るメシがうまくてなぁ
135.english: Well, my wife makes some great food.

136.speaker: WOLF
136.japanese: 幸せ太り　猛獣としてどうなの　それ
136.english: Gained some weight from a happy marriage, eh? And you call yourself a fierce beast?

137.speaker: TIGER
137.japanese: うるせえよ　お前は変わんねえな
137.english: Oh, shut up. Looks like you haven't changed.

138.speaker: WOLF
138.japanese: まあね　太っちゃうとオオカミって　わかんなくなるからさ
138.english: Yeah. Wolves don't look like wolves if we gain weight.

139.speaker: GRIZZLY
139.english: Hey, it's been a while. What are you guys up to today?

140.speaker: TIGER
140.japanese: マスター　今日は昔の仲間で…

142.speaker: GRIZZLY
142.japanese: そうかい　それなら１杯ご馳走するぜ
142.english: I see. Then your first drinks will be on me.

143.speaker: TIGER
143.japanese: やった　俺マティーニね

144.speaker: WOLF
144.japanese: 俺　バーボンおかわり

146.speaker: TIGER
146.japanese: ライオン　遅れるって

147.speaker: WOLF
147.japanese: 飛行機が遅れてるらしいぜ

148.speaker: TIGER
148.japanese: あいつ　忙しそうだしなぁ
148.english: Well, he always seems so busy.

149.speaker: WOLF
149.japanese: トラくん　実家の和菓子屋　継いだらしいじゃん
149.english: I heard you took over your family's Japanese confectionery shop.

152.speaker: WOLF
152.japanese: 代々続く　老舗のボンボン
152.english: being the rich son of a shop that's been in business for generations.

154.speaker: TIGER
154.japanese: 去年発売した肉球ねりきりが　ヒットしちゃってよぉ
154.english: Our sweet paws that came out last year became a huge hit.

155.speaker: TIGER
155.japanese: 定番のしろく饅頭とくろく饅頭も好評で
155.english: Not to mention our Polar Bear Buns and Black Bear Buns are popular as ever,

158.speaker: WOLF
158.japanese: お前にこんな商才があるなんてな
158.english: Who knew you had those kind of skills?

159.speaker: TIGER
159.japanese: 今年はまた子供生まれるし
159.english: Not to mention we have another kid coming this year...

163.speaker: TIGER
163.japanese: かわいいぜ写真見るか

164.speaker: WOLF
164.japanese: 猛獣のくせに　子供の写真見せんなよ
164.english: You're supposed to be a fierce beast. Stop showing me pictures of your kids.

165.speaker: TIGER
165.japanese: やばいだろ　上のやつの七五三の写真
165.english: Isn't she cute? This is our oldest at her  Shichi-go-san celebration.

166.speaker: WOLF
166.japanese: すっかり　マイホームパパじゃん
166.english: You're totally like a stay-at-home dad now. Well, I'm at that age.

167.speaker: WOLF
167.japanese: 猛獣のくせに　落ち着いてんじゃねえよ
167.english: You're a fierce beast. Stop settling down so much.

168.speaker: TIGER
168.japanese: そういうオオカミはどうなのよ

169.speaker: WOLF
169.english: We don't need to talk about me.

170.speaker: TIGER
170.japanese: まだあのパン屋勤めてんの
170.english: Are you still working at that bakery?

172.speaker: TIGER
172.japanese: パン屋って優しい顔の人がなる仕事だろう
172.english: Don't you have to look kind to work at a bakery?

173.speaker: TIGER
173.english: Is that really a job for a fierce beast?

174.speaker: WOLF
174.japanese: トラくんだって　老舗の和菓子屋　継いでるじゃない
174.english: Well, you're working at a traditional confectionery shop. You've got a point.

177.speaker: TIGER
177.japanese: けど…　お前もそろそろ独立したら
177.english: You know... Have you thought about becoming independent?

179.speaker: WOLF
179.english: But before that... I'd like to relax for a year on some southern island,

180.speaker: WOLF
180.japanese: 南の風に吹かれながら遠吠えしてさ…
180.english: howling as the tropical wind blows by.

181.speaker: WOLF
181.japanese: ほんとに俺のやりたいことを見つけたいんだよな
181.english: I want to find something I really want to do.

182.speaker: TIGER
182.japanese: 何だそりゃ…　まだ自分探し中かよ
182.english: What the heck? You're still trying to find yourself?

183.speaker: WOLF
183.japanese: 俺のやりたいことってパン屋じゃねえと思うんだよな
183.english: Well, I don't want to work at a bakery forever. Wolf, stop trying to find yourself.

184.speaker: GRIZZLY
184.japanese: 自分ってのは探すんじゃなくて
184.english: You're not supposed to find yourself,

186.speaker: TIGER
186.japanese: そうそう　そのとおり　パン職人が　お前の天職だ
186.english: Yeah, he's right! Exactly right! Your next job should be opening your own bakery!

187.speaker: TIGER
187.japanese: 一匹狼　目指そうぜ

188.speaker: WOLF
188.japanese: 一応　言っとくけど…

189.speaker: WOLF
189.japanese: オオカミは　もともと群れる動物なんだけど
189.english: wolves are animals that are usually in packs...

191.speaker: LION
191.japanese: よっ遅れちゃって　ごめんごめん

192.speaker: BOTH
192.japanese: おっ　ライオン　お疲れ
192.english: Hey, Lion! It's been a while!

193.speaker: LION
193.japanese: ニューヨーク出張だったんだけど
193.english: I was on a business trip in New York,

194.speaker: LION
194.japanese: 国内線の乗り換えで　待たされちゃってさぁ
194.english: and I was delayed on a domestic flight layover.

195.speaker: TIGER
195.japanese: 何だ　何だ　かっこいいじゃねえか
195.english: What the heck? How cool is that?

196.speaker: WOLF
196.japanese: さすが　商社マンだね
196.english: Nothing less from a trading company man.

197.speaker: TIGER
197.japanese: まあ　まずは再会を祝して…
197.english: Well, first, let's toast to our reunion. Cheers!

198.speaker: LION
198.japanese: 久しぶりだなぁ　グリズリーバー
198.english: It's been a while since I was at the Grizzly Bar.

199.speaker: LION
199.japanese: ずいぶん懐かしく感じるよ　そんなに経ってないのに
199.english: It's really nostalgic, even though it hasn't been {\i1}that{\i0} long.

200.speaker: WOLF
200.japanese: この間　久しぶりにインパラに会ったよ

201.speaker: LION
201.japanese: おっ　あいつ　何してんの

202.speaker: WOLF
202.japanese: 代理店かなんかで　手広くやってるらしいんだ
202.english: He's at some agency,pushing himself way too hard.

203.speaker: LION
203.japanese: へぇ～　昔は　おとなしかったのにな

204.speaker: TIGER
204.japanese: お前　忙しくしてるみたいだな
204.english: Looks like you've been keeping busy. Yeah, at this place.

205.speaker: TIGER
205.japanese: わ　ライオンが名刺交換かよ

206.speaker: LION
206.japanese: やっぱ大企業は　やりがいがあるよ
206.english: It's pretty great working at a major corporation.

207.speaker: LION
207.japanese: 規模も大きいし…　地方じゃ味わえない充実感
207.english: It's a large-scale company, and I get a satisfaction I can't experience locally.

208.speaker: LION
208.japanese: 都会の生き馬の目を抜くようなスピード感っての
208.english: Trying to keep up with the breakneck pace of the city

209.speaker: LION
209.english: is tough, even for a hunter like me.

210.speaker: WOLF
210.japanese: 狩りが得意な俺もついてくのが必死

212.speaker: TIGER
212.japanese: 狩りが得意な俺もついてくのが必死

214.speaker: WOLF
214.japanese: 獲物は母ちゃんに　とってもらってたくせに
214.english: Your mom always caught your food for you.

215.speaker: TIGER
215.japanese: ライオン　変わっちったなぁ

216.speaker: LION
216.japanese: あ…　ちょっと　言ってみたかっただけだって
216.english: Hey, I just wanted to see how it felt to say that.

217.speaker: LION
217.japanese: 俺たち　ヒップホップとか好きだったよな
217.english: We were totally into hip hop, weren't we?

218.speaker: WOLF
218.japanese: 相当　ハマってたよね

219.speaker: TIGER
219.japanese: 最近　ヒップホップ聴いてねえなぁ
219.english: Haven't been listening to hip hop lately. Pardon the intrusion.

220.speaker: WOLF
220.japanese: 今はちょっとハードすぎるよな
220.english: It's a bit too hardcore now.

221.speaker: WOLF
221.japanese: もうちょっとアンビエント系いっちゃってるよ
221.english: I've been going for more of an ambient sound.

222.speaker: TIGER
222.japanese: 俺も子供いるから　童謡系いっちゃってるよ
222.english: I've only been listening to children's songs since I have kids.

223.speaker: WOLF
223.japanese: ライブ　よく行ったよな　特に　ＭＣシロクマ
223.english: We used to go to concerts all the time. Especially MC 469MA.

224.speaker: LION
224.japanese: 神出鬼没の謎のラッパー
224.english: The mysterious, elusive rapper. He gave me chills. He was so charismatic.

225.speaker: TIGER
225.japanese: 思い出しただけで鳥肌立つぜ　トラだけどもよ
225.english: Just thinking about him gives megoosebumps, even though I'm a tiger.

227.speaker: LION
227.japanese: まあね　でももうだいぶ経つし　過去の人じゃん
227.english: Yeah. But it's been a while, so he's a person of the past. What?!

228.speaker: BOTH
228.japanese: お前　シロクマさんのこと　ディスってんの

229.speaker: LION
229.japanese: いやいや　そういうわけじゃねえけど
229.english: No, that's not what I meant.

230.speaker: LION
230.japanese: 突然　姿消しちまったしさ
230.english: But he disappeared suddenly, without a trace.

231.speaker: WOLF
231.japanese: だからこそ　伝説のラッパーとして
231.english: But that's exactly why he lives on in our hearts

232.speaker: WOLF
232.japanese: 俺たちの魂の中で　生き続けてんじゃん

233.speaker: TIGER
233.japanese: ライオンがそんなこと言うなんてな
233.english: I never thought I'd hear Lion say that.

234.speaker: WOLF
234.japanese: シロクマさんのコピーしてギグってたのに
234.english: You were even copying his style.

235.speaker: LION
235.japanese: 動物も変わってくのさ

236.speaker: WOLF
236.japanese: なんだよ　なんだよ

239.speaker: TIGER
239.japanese: おい　このあと２次会どうする
239.english: Hey, where should we go next?

240.speaker: LION
240.japanese: あっ　悪い…　俺　そろそろ出るわ
240.english: Sorry, I should probably get going.

241.speaker: LION
241.japanese: 明日　クライアントとブランチすっから
241.english: I have brunch with a client tomorrow.

242.speaker: WOLF
242.japanese: おいおい　マジかよ
242.english: Really? Are you serious? Lions shouldn't be talking about brunch!

243.speaker: ALL
243.japanese: うわ　なんだ　えっ

246.speaker: LION
246.japanese: しびれるぜ　ライム　泣かせるぜ　リリック
246.english: Those rhymes give me chills! Those lyrics bring tears to my eyes!

249.speaker: WOLF
249.english: So cool. I have mad respect for MC 469MA after all.

252.speaker: LION
252.japanese: 俺が　リスペクトだって

253.speaker: TIGER
253.japanese: 俺たちの青春は　永遠だ

254.speaker: WOLF
254.english: Yeah! Fo' sho'. Let's go to karaoke. What about your brunch tomorrow?

256.speaker: WOLF
256.japanese: よし　朝までいくか
256.english: All right. Let's go till morning.

257.speaker: LION
257.japanese: お前よ　マイクで遠吠えするのやめろよ
257.english: You better not howl into the mic.

259.speaker: WOLF
259.japanese: あの　今から　猛獣３人なんだけど
259.english: Hey, I want to make a reservation for three beasts.

261.speaker: POLAR BEAR
261.japanese: 久しぶりの再会に　シロクマからのプレゼントだよ
261.english: A gift from 469MA, in honor of their reunion.

262.speaker: PANDA
262.japanese: ペンギンさん　ペンギンさん

264.speaker: PANDA
264.japanese: 今日はペンギンさんのいいところ500挙げていこう
264.english: Let's say 500 good things about you, Mr. Penguin.

266.speaker: PENGUIN
266.japanese: 僕が自分で挙げていくんだね　この企画中止にしてもいい
266.english: I'm supposed to say them myself? Could we cancel this plan? Oh.

267.speaker: PENGUIN
267.english: What is it, Polar Bear. Nothing. Please continue. Continue.

270.speaker: POLAR BEAR
270.japanese: 来週のしろくまなんでも鑑定団は
270.english: Next week, on Polar Bear's Antiques Roadshow—

271.speaker: PENGUIN
271.english: Polar Bear's Café! Are you okay?!
